title.div: The Well-being of Future Generations (Wales) Act 2015 (Commencement) Order 2015 / Gorchymyn Deddf Llesiant Cenedlaethau’r Dyfodol (Cymru) 2015 (Cychwyn) 2015

div.p: This is the first commencement order made by the Welsh Ministers under the Well-being of Future Generations (Wales) Act 2015 (“the Act”).
Hwn yw’r gorchymyn cychwyn cyntaf a wneir gan Weinidogion Cymru o dan Ddeddf Llesiant Cenedlaethau’r Dyfodol (Cymru) 2015 (“y Ddeddf”).

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Fixed Penalty) (Offences) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: This Order amends Schedule 1 to the Road Traffic (Fixed Penalty) (Offences) Order (Northern Ireland) 1997 to—

title.div: The Planning (Wales) Act 2015 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2015 / Gorchymyn Deddf Cynllunio (Cymru) 2015 (Cychwyn Rhif 1) 2015

div.p: This Order is the first commencement order made by the Welsh Ministers under the Planning (Wales) Act 2015 (“the Act”).
Y Gorchymyn hwn yw’r gorchymyn cychwyn cyntaf a wneir gan Weinidogion Cymru o dan Ddeddf Cynllunio (Cymru) 2015 (“y Ddeddf”).

title.div: The Apprenticeships (Designation of Welsh Certifying Authority) (Amendment) Order 2015 / Gorchymyn Prentisiaethau (Dynodi Awdurdod Ardystio Cymru) (Diwygio) 2015

div.p: This Order amends the Apprenticeships (Designation of Welsh Certifying Authority) Order 2013 by changing the name of the Welsh certifying authority from the Alliance of Sector Skills Councils to the Federation for Industry Sector Skills and Standards. This recognises a change in the registered company name of this organisation.

Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn diwygio Gorchymyn Prentisiaethau (Dynodi Awdurdod Ardystio Cymru) 2013 drwy newid enw awdurdod ardystio Cymru o Gynghrair y Cynghorau Sgiliau Sector i Ffederasiwn Sgiliau a Safonau’r Sector Diwydiant. Mae hyn yn cydnabod y newid yn enw cwmni cofrestredig y sefydliad hwn.

entry.title: The Enterprise Act 2002 (Part 8 Domestic Infringements) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Enterprise Act 2002 (Part 8 Domestic Infringements) Order 2015

entry.summary: Part 8 of the Enterprise Act 2002 (c.40) (“the Act”) enables persons and bodies which are general or designated enforcers to seek enforcement orders prohibiting domestic and Community infringements. Section 211(1) of the Act defines a domestic infringement as an act or omission done or made by a person in the course of a business which falls within section 211(2) and harms the collective interests of consumers in the United Kingdom.

entry.title: The Energy Savings Opportunity Scheme (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations, issued free of charge, amend Schedules 1, 2 and 4 to the Energy Savings Opportunity Scheme Regulations 2014 to correct drafting errors. Those Regulations implement Article 8(4) to (6) of Directive 2012/27/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on energy efficiency.

entry.title: The Consumer Rights Act 2015 (Consequential Amendments) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Consumer Rights Act 2015 (Consequential Amendments) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order makes amendments to legislation in consequence of provisions of the Consumer Rights Act 2015 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Private and Public Water Supplies (Miscellaneous Amendments) (Scotland) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Private Water Supplies (Scotland) Regulations 2006 and the Public Water Supplies (Scotland) Regulations 2014 with the aim of further protecting human health from the adverse effects of any contamination of water supplied for human consumption purposes.

entry.title: The Deregulation Act 2015 (Commencement No.3 and Transitional and Saving Provisions) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order (“the Order”) brings into force the specified provisions of the Deregulation Act 2015 (“the Act”) on the dates specified. A reference in this Note to a section is to a section of the Act unless otherwise stated.

entry.title: The Renewables Obligation Closure Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: This Order makes provision for no renewables obligation certificates to be issued under a renewables obligation order in respect of electricity generated after 31st March 2017 unless the electricity is generated in any one or more of the circumstances provided for in the Order.

entry.title: The Counter-Terrorism and Security Act 2015 (Commencement No. 3) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations bring into force, on 1st October 2015, those parts of section 25 of the Counter-Terrorism and Security Act 2015 (“the Act”), and of Schedule 5 to that Act, that are not already in force. These are paragraphs 12 to 14 of Schedule 5 to the Act and section 25 of the Act, so far as relating to those paragraphs. These provisions relate to rail and maritime transport.

entry.title: The Merchant Shipping (Alcohol) (Prescribed Limits Amendment) Regulations 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Merchant Shipping (Alcohol) (Prescribed Limits Amendment) Regulations 2015

entry.summary: These Regulations set new, lower limits of alcohol for the purposes of Part 4 (Shipping: Alcohol and Drugs) of the Railways and Transport Safety Act 2003.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Primary Dental Services) (Miscellaneous Amendments) (No. 2) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the National Health Service (General Dental Services Contracts) Regulations 2005 (the GDS Regulations), the National Health Service (Personal Dental Services Agreements) Regulations 2005 (the PDS Regulations), the National Health Service (Dental Charges) Regulations 2015 (the Dental Charges Regulations) and the Functions of the National Health Service Commissioning Board and the NHS Business Services Authority (Awdurdod Gwasanaethau Busnes y GIG) (Primary Dental Services) (England) Regulations 2013 (the BSA Functions Regulations).

entry.title: The National Minimum Wage (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the National Minimum Wage Regulations 2015 (“the 2015 Regulations”). These Regulations come into force on 1st October 2015.

entry.title: The Assured Shorthold Tenancy Notices and Prescribed Requirements (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations substitute a new form for the form contained in the Schedule to the Assured Shorthold Tenancy Notices and Prescribed Requirements (England) Regulations 2015 (S.I. 2015/1646) in order to correct an error which was identified in the original form. A number of other drafting and formatting changes have also been made to the new form to make it more accessible to users.

title.div: The Social Services and Well-being (Wales) Act 2014 (Commencement No. 2) Order 2015 / Gorchymyn Deddf Gwasanaethau Cymdeithasol a Llesiant (Cymru) 2014 (Cychwyn Rhif 2) 2015

div.p: This is the second Commencement Order made by the Welsh Ministers under the Social Services and Well-being (Wales) Act 2014 (“the Act”).
Hwn yw’r ail Orchymyn Cychwyn a wnaed gan Weinidogion Cymru o dan Ddeddf Gwasanaethau Cymdeithasol a Llesiant (Cymru) 2014 (“y Ddeddf”).

entry.title: The Community Empowerment (Scotland) Act 2015 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2015
entry.summary: Sections 141 to 143, 145 and 146 of the Community Empowerment (Scotland) Act 2015 came into force on 25th July 2015, being the day after Royal Assent.

entry.title: The Planning (Hazardous Substances) (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations implement the land-use planning obligations (articles 13 and 15) in Directive 2012/18/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the control of major-accident hazards involving dangerous substances (O.J. 197, 24.7.2012, p.1) (“the Seveso III Directive”).

title.div: The Plant Health (Forestry) (Amendment) (Wales) Order 2015 / Gorchymyn Iechyd Planhigion (Coedwigaeth) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2015

div.p: This Order applies in relation to Wales certain provisions which have been made amending the Plant Health (Forestry) Order 2005 (S.I. 2005/2517) (“the 2005 Order”) in relation to England and Scotland. Those amendments were made by the Plant Health (Forestry) (England and Scotland) (Amendment) Order 2013 (S.I. 2013/2691) (“the 2013 Order”) and the Plant Health (Forestry) (England and Scotland) (Amendment) Order 2014 (S.I. 2014/2420) (“the 2014 Order”). Those Orders implemented in relation to England and Scotland certain provisions in Commission Implementing Directive 2014/78/EU of 17th June 2014 (OJ L 183, 24.6.2014, p. 23–48) and Commission Implementing Directive 2014/78/EU of 25th June 2014 (OJ L 186, 26.6.2014, p. 64–71). This Order implements those provisions in relation to Wales.

Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn cymhwyso o ran Cymru ddarpariaethau penodol sydd wedi eu gwneud i ddiwygio Gorchymyn Iechyd Planhigion (Coedwigaeth) 2005 (O.S. 2005/2517) (“Gorchymyn 2005”) o ran Lloegr a’r Alban. Gwnaed y diwygiadau hynny gan Orchymyn Iechyd Planhigion (Coedwigaeth) (Lloegr a’r Alban) (Diwygio) 2013 (O.S. 2013/2691) (“Gorchymyn 2013”) a Gorchymyn Iechyd Planhigion (Coedwigaeth) (Lloegr a’r Alban) (Diwygio) 2014 (O.S. 2014/2420) (“Gorchymyn 2014”). Roedd y Gorchmynion hynny’n gweithredu o ran Lloegr a’r Alban ddarpariaethau penodol yng Nghyfarwyddeb Weithredu’r Comisiwn 2014/78/EU ddyddiedig 17 Mehefin 2014 (OJ L 183, 24.6.2014, t. 23–48) a Chyfarwyddeb Weithredu’r Comisiwn 2014/78/EU ddyddiedig 25 Mehefin 2014 (OJ L 186, 26.6.2014, t. 64–71). Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn gweithredu’r darpariaethau hynny o ran Cymru.

entry.title: The General Teaching Council for Northern Ireland (Constitution) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the General Teaching Council for Northern Ireland (Constitution) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001 to extend the term of office of elected Council members whose term would otherwise have ended on 14th October 2015 by a further six months (regulation 2(2)). That regulation also extends the term of office of members appointed by the Department of Education until 29th February 2016. In both cases the term of office of members will end on 14th October 2019. Regulation 2(3) makes minor amendments.
